lines.text: You must be pretty proud of yourself, breaking up our meeting like that.
After that, you couldn't run for a streetcar!

[Last lines at the commencement of Myrtle and Benny's marriage ceremony]
And, you know, it isn't every young couple that can have the wedding ceremony performed by Her Honor, the Mayor.
[indicating Hattie]
No, and it isn't every young couple that can have as Matron of Honor, the Commissioner of Garbage.
[indicating Ivy]
I'll have you know that singers run in my family.
I don't blame 'em!
Put that foot down where it belongs!
If I did, you wouldn't be able to sit down for months!
If it wasn't for us women, where would you men be?
In the Garden of Eden eatin' apples.
Rally, my eye! You're going top stay home and iron my underw-w-w-wear!
Iron them yourself, and, furthermore, after the election you'll be ironing mine!

[Listening to the corrupt mayor speaking to a women's club on the radio]
Hah! We're a cinch! Don't those old dames fall for color? That guy could bring tears to a glass eye!
For the first time in history women had men worried.
Well, what's your proposition?
Well, just this... if I let you in as mayor, all I want to do is handle the business end of the office, and you can handle the social welfare and public improvements.
Oh, well, the first public improvement I'm gonna make is to run you outta town.

[Referring to Peter]
Oh, Ivy, kiss him. He can't suffer more than he has already.

[to Ivy]
What's my p-pants doing wrapped around your b-b-bird cage?
